location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lewis Pelly, Bushire to Sir William Robert Seymour Vesey Fitzgerald, Governor of Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter asking if one of the steamers from the Abyssinia expedition could be sent for use in the Gulf as May Frereis unsuited to the work in the Gulf and suggesting that should a steamer be available it could bring barrack material and tanks for use at Bassidore and elsewhere.The letter also discusses affairs in Persia and the settling of the Bunder Abbass [Bandar Abbas] affair.The letter concludes by informing the Viceroy that the Abyssinian War has been much talked about in the Gulf region and should the rumours of victory be true Pelly will have salutes fired and the flag staff dressed.
